question: Who is most likely to pull a Banksy and paint a mural in an abandoned lot in your town (even if it means getting busted for trespassing)?
stat:
Did you know students who study art are 4 times more likely to be recognized for academic achievement?

Learn how you can get more art in your school at DoSomething.org.

question: Who is most likely to become a cat lady?
stat:
Four million abandoned dogs and cats are put down every year for being homeless. The world needs more cat ladies!

Learn how you can get pets adopted at DoSomething.org.

question: Who is most likely to visit a developing nation?
stat: Did you know a whopping 1.3 billion people live on less than a $1 dollar a day? Yikes.

question: Who is most likely to not shower for a month, all in the name of Mother Earth?
stat:
Let your friend know there are more, um, hygienic ways to protect the environment.

Challenge each other to see who can collect and recycle the most aluminum cans at DoSomething.org.

question: Who is most likely to update their wardrobe every month?
stat:
If you're cleaning out your closet, you may as well put those clothes to good use! Have a pair of jeans you're not wearing anymore? Donate them to a teen experiencing homelessness.

Click here for more at DoSomething.org.

question: Who is most likely to use 1 piece of toilet paper to save money?
stat:
Your friend sounds pretty innovative when it comes to saving $$, but...uh, that's just weird. Host a workshop to teach personal finance. (Psst...you could win a $10,000 scholarship!)

Learn more at DoSomething.org.

question: Who is most likely to sell their kideny to see One Direction?
stat:
If you're willing to give up an organ for 1D, are you willing to share your spit and possible save someone's life? (Zayn says, "Saving lives is sexy.")

Sign up to be on the bone marrow registry--all it takes is some spit: http://www.dosomething.org/spit

question: Who is most likely to post a photo of every single meal on Instagram? #foodporn
stat:
If you're going to make everyone look at pictures of your food, trying putting it to good use.

Let the world know the state of school lunches by uploading your lunch pics at DoSomething.org.

question: Who is the most likely to listen to Drake's Nothing Was the Same on repeat? on repeat? on repeat?
stat:
Did you know recycling 1 aluminum can produces enough energy to listen to a full album on your iPod? Collect 50 cans and listen to Drake 50 times. Nonstop Drizzy.

http://www.dosomething.org/50cans
